description: The win condition
any highest: Beat any map from your highest tier
all highest: Beat all the maps from your highest tier
all: Beat all the maps from all your tiers
Enables honor-based deathlink
Receiving a deathlink means resetting the current run (/r)
Sending a deathlink is optional, but 'failing X times in a run' is a recommended condition

_filler_traps._comment: Using values here let you set a 'recommended' filler_trap percentage or even a default percentage

description: The tiers of maps to be added to the pool
Format: LowerTier-HigherTier (or just LowerTier), E.g. 't1-t2' or 't3'
Tier 1 (162 maps): Super easy maps that take little effort (Brick, Lemon)
Tier 2 (140 maps): Still simple, but not trivial (Royalty, Adventure V2)
Tier 3 (123 maps): Longer maps with proper platforming (Technicolor, Patent)
Tier 4 ( 51 maps): Even longer, more involved maps that require skill (Arcane V2, RPG)
Tier 5 ( 24 maps): Proper accuracy maps, from VLM/Dracula to Badges2/Sqee
Tier 6 (  4 maps): The hardest maps available
Only include a certain percentage of maps from the tiers above
Helpful if you don't want to run every accuracy map in the game or all 200+ strafe maps
Allows 'Meme' maps to be added to the pool
This covers stupid, long, and gimmick maps, like Lazy Larry or Ka-Chow!
Meme maps still need their associated tier enabled to be added
This applies to 7 maps
Allows 'Tedious' maps to be added to the pool
This covers maps that focus on a super specific skill set or have very few checkpoints, like Plink, :3, or Trials
Tedious maps still need their associated tier enabled to be added
This applies to 7 maps

starting_maps.description: How many maps start unlocked from the beginning

description: Adds a progressive lock to tiers
This ensures higher tier maps only become playable later into the run
Maps will still be unlocked individually
Enables an extra 'No-Fail' check on maps in the specified tiers
Format: LowerTier-HigherTier (or just LowerTier), E.g. 't1-t2' or 't3'
Set to 'off' to disable these checks entirely
